content: Singaporean poet and artist **Desmond Kon Zhicheng-Mingdé** (born 1971) is a poet, former journalist, interdisciplinary artist and founder of Squircle Line Press. He has authored ten poetry collections, an epistolary novel, and edited more than fifteen books. He has an MFA in creative writing, and is also an avid potter. ## Education Born in 1971, Desmond studied sociology and mass communication at the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore) in 1995. He went on to receive his theology masters (world religions) from [Harvard University](/wiki/Harvard_University) in 2006 and fine arts masters (creative writing) from the [University of Notre Dame](/wiki/University_of_Notre_Dame) in 2009. He was trained in book publishing at [Stanford University](/wiki/Stanford_University) in 2001. ## Literary career In 2014, he won the Poetry World Cup while representing [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). He is the curator of the "eye feel write" ekphrastic collaboration between the [Singapore Writers Festival](/wiki/Singapore_Writers_Festival), the [Singapore Arts Museum](/wiki/Singapore_Art_Museum) and the [National Gallery Singapore](/wiki/National_Gallery_Singapore). He is also a mentor for the [National Arts Council](/wiki/National_Arts_Council_(Singapore))'s Mentor Access Project. In 2016, he co-won the [Singapore Literature Prize](/wiki/Singapore_Literature_Prize) for English Poetry for his poetry collection, "I Didn't Know Mani Was a Conceptualist", published with [Math Paper Press](/wiki/Math_Paper_Press). Desmond Kon’s writing has appeared in over 200 literary publications, including *AGNI,* [Ambit](/wiki/Ambit_(magazine)), *[Asymptote](/wiki/Asymptote_(magazine))*, *[Harvard Review](/wiki/Harvard_Review)*, *[Hayden’s Ferry Review](/wiki/Hayden%27s_Ferry_Review)*, *[Jacket2](/wiki/Jacket2)*, *[New Orleans Review](/wiki/New_Orleans_Review)*, *[Notre Dame Review](/wiki/Notre_Dame_Review)*, *[QLRS](/wiki/Quarterly_Literary_Review_Singapore)*, *[Seneca Review](/wiki/Seneca_Review)*, *[The Massachusetts Review](/wiki/The_Massachusetts_Review)*, *The New Guard*, *Versal*, and *Voice & Verse*. His other honours include the [IBPA Benjamin Franklin Gold Award](/wiki/IBPA_Benjamin_Franklin_Awards) (Poetry), two Illumination Christian Book Gold Awards (Digital Media in consecutive years), and the PEN American Center Shorts Prize, among other accolades. Desmond Kon is cited as the inventor of several poetic forms, including the asingbol, the anima methodi, and the found//fount sonnet. ## Selected bibliography ### Poetry collections - *The Arbitrary Sign*. 2013.
